title: Vintage Archery & Shooting Sports
description: Take aim and recall the proud traditions of archery, marksmanship, and shooting sports that were cherished pastimes for generations!

questions.question: Fred Bear, the legendary founder of Bear Archery, helped popularize which style of hunting in the mid-20th century?
Which type of bow, with its distinctive curved tips, was the most popular hunting bow before compound bows appeared in the late 1960s?
The compound bow, which uses a system of pulleys and cables, was invented by Holless Wilbur Allen in which decade?
Which TV Western hero, played by Chuck Connors, was famous for his skill with a rifle?
Annie Oakley, the famous sharpshooter, performed in which legendary Wild West show?
Skeet shooting, a popular competitive shooting sport, involves shooting at clay targets launched from how many stations?
The BB gun made by which company was a dream gift for countless American boys and was featured in 'A Christmas Story'?
The Daisy Red Ryder BB gun, introduced in 1940, was named after which type of fictional character?
Howard Hill, considered one of the greatest archers of all time, performed trick shots in which famous 1938 movie?
options: The Charge of the Light Brigade

questions.question: Trap shooting involves clay targets launched from how many locations?
Which American shooter won seven Olympic medals across four consecutive Olympics from 1984 to 1996, becoming one of the most decorated Olympic shooters?
The National Rifle Association (NRA) was originally founded in 1871 to improve what among citizens?
What were clay shooting targets traditionally called, even though they hadn't been made from actual birds since the 1880s?
Which famous American archer and outdoorsman co-founded the Pope and Young Club for bowhunting records?
The .22 caliber rifle was considered the ideal starter rifle for young shooters. What feature made it popular for beginners?
options: Its low recoil and affordable ammunition
